title: Label-Retrieval-Augmented Diffusion Models for Learning from Noisy Labels. (arXiv:2305.19518v1 [cs.LG])
abstract: Learning from noisy labels is an important and long-standing problem in machine learning for real applications. One of the main research lines focuses on learning a label corrector to purify potential noisy labels. However, these methods typically rely on strict assumptions and are limited to certain types of label noise. In this paper, we reformulate the label-noise problem from a generative-model perspective, $\textit{i.e.}$, labels are generated by gradually refining an initial random guess. This new perspective immediately enables existing powerful diffusion models to seamlessly learn the stochastic generative process. Once the generative uncertainty is modeled, we can perform classification inference using maximum likelihood estimation of labels. translated_title: 基于标签检索的扩散模型用于学习嘈杂标签
translated_abstract: 学习如何从带有嘈杂标签的数据集中获取信息，一直是机器学习领域的一个重要课题。传统方法通常依赖于比较严格的假设，而且受限于特定类型的标签噪声。本文提出了一种标签噪声问题的生成模型，用于学习和判断随机的标签。作者利用这一模型，提出了基于标签检索的扩散模型，来有效的构造和利用伪干净标签，从而减小嘈杂标签的影响。
tldr: 本论文提出了一种基于标签检索的扩散模型，用于有效构造并利用伪干净标签，以减小嘈杂标签对分类影响。
en_tdlr: This paper presents a label-retrieval-augmented diffusion model for constructing and utilizing pseudo-clean labels to mitigate the impact of noisy labels. The proposed model utilizes a generative-model perspective to learn and infer the stochastic generative process of labels.
